summary: I OWN A 1999 CHEVROLET EXPRESS 1500 VAN WITH LESS THAN  50,000 MILES ON IT.  I PURCHASED THE VAN NEW IN 1999.  I NOW HAVE A PROBLEM WITH THE OIL PRESSURE GAUGE FALLING PAST 80 PSI ALL THE TIME.  EVEN WHEN THE VAN IS NOT RUNNING.  I HAVE TRIED TWO DIFFERENT CLUSTER WITH THE SAME RESULTS.  I HAVE NOT CONFIDENCE THAT ANYONE AT GM KNOWS HOW TO FIX THIS ISSUE.  NO RESOLUTION CAN BE FOUND.  *TR

SPEEDOMETER DOES NOT REGISTER THE CORRECT SPEED AND JUMPS UP TO VERY HIGH READING (100 MPH+) WHEN ON THE HIGHWAY.  CAUSES TRANSMISSION TO SHIFT IMPROPERLY DO TO INACCURATE READING.  OCCURS ALL THE TIME NOW.  UNABLE TO REPAIR AT THIS POINT. *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 1999 CHEVROLET EXPRESS 1500.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE STATE INSPECTION STATION.  THE TECHNICIAN OBSERVED THAT WHEN THE HEADLIGHTS ARE ACTIVATED, THE BRAKE LIGHTS DO NOT WORK.  THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO AN INDEPENDENT REPAIR SHOP AND THEY STATED THAT THE FAILURE WAS RELATED TO THE ELECTRICAL LAMP SWITCH OR 3-WAY SOCKET.  THE VEHICLE HAS NOT BEEN REPAIRED.  THE FAILURE AND CURRENT MILEAGES WERE 80,000.  UPDATED 11/17/08 *CN  UPDATED 11/21/08,.*JB

1999 CHEVY EXPRESS VAN.  RIGHT AND LEFT BRAKE LIGHTS FAIL TO OPERATE CORRECTLY.  APPLICATION OF BRAKES CAUSES BRAKE LIGHT TO DIM INSTEAD OF GETTING BRIGHTER.  PROBLEM OBSERVED IN MANY CHEVY EXPRESS VANS WITH IDENTICAL TAIL LIGHTS.  PROBLEM TRACED TO CORRODED GROUND CONNECTION IN BOTH TAIL LIGHT/BRAKE LIGHT BULB SOCKETS.  ADVANCE AUTO PARTS AND NAPA SELL REPLACEMENT WIRING HARNESSES THAT INCLUDES ALL THREE BULB SOCKETS.  ADVANCE AUTO PARTS UNIT MUST HAVE THE CONNECTOR RECONFIGURED TO MATCH THE FACTORY BODY CONNECTOR.   *JB
